alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Lafayette; Nevada; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 12:57AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Lafayette, northwestern Union, southern Nevada and northern Columbia Counties through 1245 AM CST... At 1157 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of White Oak Lake State Park to Willisville to near Stamps. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Magnolia, Stamps, Waldo, McNeil, Buckner, Rosston, Willisville, Village, Mount Holly, Macedonia, Calhoun, Mount Vernon, Young, Ebenezer, Laughlin, Waterloo, Falcon, College Hill, Lamartine and Medlock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Arkansas.
